math_problem:
Determine all functions $f:\mathbb{R}\to\mathbb{R}$ such that for every pair of real numbers $x$ and $y$,  
\[f(x+y^2)=f(x)+|y f(y)|.\] Instead of characterizing all functions satisfying the given functional equation, simply find $k = f(0) + 4$, where $f(0)$ is the value of the function at zero derived from analysis of the functional equation. There are arbitrary $(k + 3)$ points in the plane. Circles are drawn through every $k$ possible concyclic points. Find the maximum number of circles that can be drawn.

A88: Mathematics -> Algebra -> Algebra -> Equations and Inequalities
